intro: Pedicularis brachyodonta subsp. montenegrina, commonly known as the Montenegro horned poppy, is a member of the Orobanchaceae family and is native to the Balkan region. It is a herbaceous perennial that produces striking, tubular flowers with a distinctive horn-like spur. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. Its flowering period occurs in late spring to early summer, and it is known for its vivid orange to red floral colors. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species in its native range.
